org.jsfml.graphics

Class RenderWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jsfml.internal.SFMLNativeObject
      • org.jsfml.window.Window
        • org.jsfml.graphics.RenderWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RenderTarget, WindowStyle

    public class RenderWindow
extends Window
implements RenderTarget
    Provides a window that can serve as a target for 2D drawing.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.jsfml.window.WindowStyle

        CLOSE, DEFAULT, FULLSCREEN, NONE, RESIZE, TITLEBAR

      • RenderWindow

        public RenderWindow(VideoMode mode,
            String title,
            int style,
            ContextSettings settings)
        Constructs a new render window and creates it with the specified parameters.
        Parameters:
        mode - the video mode to use for rendering.
        title - the window title.
        style - the window style.
        settings - the settings for the OpenGL context.
        See Also:
        create(org.jsfml.window.VideoMode, String, int, org.jsfml.window.ContextSettings)

      • RenderWindow

        title - the window title.
        style - the window style.
        See Also:

      • create

        public void create(VideoMode mode,
          String title,
          int style,
          ContextSettings settings)
        Description copied from class: Window
        Creates and opens a window or re-creates it if it was already opened.
        Overrides:
        create in class Window
        Parameters:
        mode - the video mode that determines the window's size. This must be a valid video mode in case WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN is set.
        title - the window title.
        style - the style of the window. This should be a combination (using OR of the style flags WindowStyle.TITLEBAR, WindowStyle.RESIZE, WindowStyle.CLOSE and WindowStyle.FULLSCREEN, or WindowStyle.NONE for no style. WindowStyle.DEFAULT provides a default combination of style flags.
        settings - the context settings for the created OpenGL context.
        See Also:
        VideoMode.isValid(), WindowStyle, ContextSettings

      • capture

        public Image capture()
        Copies the current contents of the window to an image.

        This is a slow operation and should be used to take screenshots, not to re-use resulting image as a texture. For that, use Texture.update(org.jsfml.window.Window) or a RenderTexture instead.

        Returns:
        the image with the current contents of the window.
